DataElement.preferredName: Vaginal Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Clinical Tumor T Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the primary cancer of the vagina based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to clinical evaluated T stage of a vaginal tumor.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Relating to the vagina or to any sheath.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: Of or relating to the vagina.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC:American Joint Committee on Cancer Cancer Staging Manual, 6th Ed., 2002

ValueDomain.preferredName: Vaginal Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 T Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of vaginal cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion)._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Vaginal Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Vaginal Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Vaginal cancer with no evidence of primary tumor. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Vaginal Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Vaginal cancer with no evidence of primary tumor. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Vaginal Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Vaginal Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Vaginal cancer with a tumor confined to vagina. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Vaginal Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Vaginal cancer with a tumor confined to vagina. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Vaginal Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Vaginal Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Vaginal cancer invading the paravaginal tissues but not the pelvic wall. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Vaginal Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Vaginal cancer invading the paravaginal tissues but not the pelvic wall. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Vaginal Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Vaginal Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Vaginal cancer extending to the pelvic wall.  Pelvic wall is defined as muscle, fascia, neurovascular structures, or skeletal portions of the bony pelvis.  (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Vaginal Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Vaginal cancer extending to the pelvic wall.  Pelvic wall is defined as muscle, fascia, neurovascular structures, or skeletal portions of the bony pelvis.  (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Vaginal Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Vaginal Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Vaginal cancer invading the mucosa of the bladder or rectum and/or extending beyond the true pelvis (bullous edema is not sufficient evidence to classify a tumor as T4) .  (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Vaginal Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Vaginal cancer invading the mucosa of the bladder or rectum and/or extending beyond the true pelvis (bullous edema is not sufficient evidence to classify a tumor as T4).  (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Vaginal Cancer pTis TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Vaginal Cancer pTis TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Vaginal cancer with a finding of carcinoma in situ. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Vaginal Cancer pTis TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Vaginal cancer with a finding of carcinoma in situ. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Vaginal Cancer pTX TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Vaginal Cancer pTX TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Vaginal cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Vaginal Cancer pTX TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Vaginal cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).:The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.definition: A finding about one or more characteristics of vaginal cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system.
A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).
The extent of a cancer in the body.
